name: src/core/History.js
elements
description: The elements that have been executed during the current session.

name: push
description: Adds an SDF to the operation history.

return.description: The new length of the history list.

name: pop
description: Removes the SDF that was last added to the history and returns it.

return.description: An SDF consisting of all past operations, or null if there are none.

name: src/core/index.js
src/core/PriorityQueue.js
PriorityQueue
description:
A queue that maintains elements in a hierarchy. Elements with a high priority
will be served before elements with a lower priority.

params.name: tiers
params.description: The number of priority tiers. The lowest tier represents the lowest priority.

return.description: The index of the added element.
The removed element or null if there was none.

name: peek
description:
Retrieves, but does not remove, the head of the queue, or returns null if
the queue is empty.

name: poll
description: Retrieves the head of the queue, or returns null if the queue is empty.

name: src/core/Queue.js
size
description: The current size of the queue.

name: add
description: Adds an element to the queue.

return.description: The index of the added element.

name: remove
description: Removes an element from the queue.

return.description: The removed element or null if there was none.

name: peek
description:
Retrieves, but does not remove, the head of the queue, or returns null if
the queue is empty.

name: poll
description:
Retrieves and removes the head of the queue, or returns null if the queue
is empty.

name: src/core/RunLengthEncoder.js

return.description: The run-lengths and the encoded data.

name: src/core/Scheduler.js
registry
description: Keeps track of associations between elements and tasks.

name: cancel
description: Cancels the task that is currently scheduled for the given element.

name: schedule
description:
Schedules a task for the given element. Other tasks that are scheduled for
that element will be cancelled.

name: hasTask
description: Checks if a task is scheduled for the given element.

return.description: Whether a task is currently scheduled.

name: getTask
description: Retrieves the task for the given element.

return.description: The task or undefined if there is none.

name: poll
description: Retrieves the head of the queue, or returns null if the queue is empty.

return.description: The task with the highest priority or null if there is none.

name: src/core/Task.js
src/core/terrain-events.js
modificationstart
description:
Signals the start of a modification task.

This event is dispatched by {@link Terrain}.

name: modificationend
description:
Signals the end of a modification task.

This event is dispatched by {@link Terrain}.

name: extractionstart
description:
Signals the start of an extraction task.

This event is dispatched by {@link Terrain}.

name: extractionend
description:
Signals the end of an extraction task.

This event is dispatched by {@link Terrain}.

name: src/core/Terrain.js

params.name: options.chunkSize
params.description: The world size of a volume chunk. Will be rounded up to the next power of two.

params.name: options.resolution
params.description: The resolution of a volume chunk. Will be rounded up to the next power of two.

params.name: options.workers
params.description: Limits the amount of active workers. The default limit is the amount of logical processors which is also the maximum.

params.name: options.levels
params.description: The amount of detail levels. The default number of levels is derived from the resolution.

params.name: options.iterations
params.description: Limits the amount of volume chunks that are being processed during each update.

name: object
description: The terrain object. Add this to your scene.

name: levels
description:
The number of detail levels.

Terrain chunks that are further away from the camera will be rendered
with less vertices.

name: iterations
description:
The maximum amount of chunk iterations per update.

Volume chunks that lie in the field of view will be processed over the
course of several update calls.

name: history
description:
A chronological sequence of CSG operations that have been executed during
this session.

name: neutered
description:
Keeps track of chunks that are currently being used by a worker. The
amount of neutered chunks cannot exceed the amount of worker threads.

name: chunks
description: Keeps track of associations between workers and chunks.

name: meshes
description: Keeps track of associations between chunks and meshes.

name: unlinkMesh
description: Lifts the connection of a given chunk to its mesh and removes the geometry.

name: consolidate
description: Updates geometry chunks with extracted data.

params.name: data
params.description: An object containing the extracted geometry data.

name: runNextTask
description: Runs a pending task if a worker is available.

name: union
description: Executes the given SDF and adds the generated data to the volume.

name: subtract
description: Executes the given SDF and subtracts the generated data from the volume.

name: intersect
description:
Executes the given SDF and discards the volume data that doesn't overlap
with the generated data.

name: update
description: Updates the terrain geometry. This method should be called each frame.

name: raycast
description:
Finds the terrain chunks that intersect with the given ray and raycasts the
associated meshes.

Intersections are sorted by distance, closest first.

name: clear
description: Resets this terrain by removing data and closing active worker threads.

name: dispose
description: Destroys this terrain and frees internal resources.

name: save
description: Saves a description of the current volume data.

return.description: A URL to the exported save data, or null if there is no data.

name: DualContouring
description:
Dual Contouring is an isosurface extraction technique that was originally
presented by Tao Ju in 2002:
 http://www.cs.wustl.edu/~taoju/research/dualContour.pdf

name: run
description:
Contours the given chunk of volume data and generates vertices, normals
and vertex indices.

return.description: The generated indices, positions and normals, or null if no data was generated.

name: src/math/QEFSolver.js
QEFSolver
description:
A Quaratic Error Function solver.

Finds a point inside a voxel that minimises the sum of the squares of the
distances to the surface intersection planes associated with the voxel.

params.name: svdThreshold
params.description: A threshold for the Singular Value Decomposition error.

params.name: svdSweeps
params.description: Number of Singular Value Decomposition sweeps.

params.name: pseudoInverseThreshold
params.description: A threshold for the pseudo inverse error.

name: svdThreshold
description: A Singular Value Decomposition error threshold.

name: svdSweeps
description: The number of Singular Value Decomposition sweeps.

name: massPoint
description: The average of the surface intersection points of a voxel.

name: hasSolution
description: Indicates whether this solver has a solution.

name: computeError
description: Computes the error of the approximated position.

params.name: svdSweeps

return.description: A dimension indicating the amount of truncated singular values.

name: calculateError
description: Calculates the error of the Singular Value Decomposition.

BIAS

description: An error threshold for the Zero Crossing approximation.

name: computeSurfaceNormal
description: Computes the normal of the surface at the edge intersection.
todo: Use analytical derivation instead of finite differences.

name: src/volume/EdgeData.js
EdgeData
description:
Stores edge data separately for each dimension.

With a grid resolution N, there are `3 * (N + 1) * N` edges in total, but
the number of edges that actually contain the volume's surface is usually
much lower.

params.name: x
params.description: The amount of edges along the X-axis.

params.name: y
params.description: The amount of edges along the Y-axis. If omitted, this will be the same as x.

params.name: z
params.description: The amount of edges along the Z-axis. If omitted, this will be the same as x.

name: edges
description:
The edges.

Edges are stored as starting grid point indices in ascending order. The
ending point indices are implicitly defined through the dimension split:

Given a starting point index A, the ending point index B for the X-, Y-
and Z-axis is defined as `A + 1`, `A + N` and `A + N` respectively where
N is the grid resolution + 1.

name: zeroCrossings
description:
The Zero Crossing interpolation values.

Each value describes the relative surface intersection position on the
respective edge. The values correspond to the order of the edges.

name: normals
description:
The surface intersection normals.

The vectors are stored as [x, y, z] float triples and correspond to the
order of the edges.

name: createTransferList
description: Creates a list of transferable items.

params.description: An existing list to be filled with transferable items.

return.description: The serialised version of the data.

name: calculate1DEdgeCount
description: Calculates the amount of edges for one axis based on a given resolution.

return.description: The amount of edges for a single dimension.

name: src/volume/sdf/SDFType.js
content:
/**
 * An enumeration of SDF types.
 *
 * @type {Object}
 * @property {String} SPHERE - A sphere description.
 * @property {String} BOX - A box description.
 * @property {String} TORUS - A torus description.
 * @property {String} PLANE - A plane description.
 * @property {String} HEIGHTFIELD - A heightfield description.
 */

export const SDFType = {

	SPHERE: "sdf.sphere",
	BOX: "sdf.box",
	TORUS: "sdf.torus",
	PLANE: "sdf.plane",
	HEIGHTFIELD: "sdf.heightfield"

};

name: src/volume/sdf/SignedDistanceFunction.js
SignedDistanceFunction
description:
An abstract Signed Distance Function.

An SDF describes the signed Euclidean distance to the surface of an object,
effectively describing its density at every point in 3D space. It yields
negative values for points that lie inside the volume and positive values
for points outside. The value is zero at the exact boundary of the object.

params.name: material
params.description: A material index. Must be an integer in the range of 1 to 255.

name: children
description:
A list of SDFs.

SDFs can be chained to build CSG expressions.

name: bbox
description: The bounding box of this SDF.

name: boundingBox
description: The bounding box of this SDF.

name: completeBoundingBox
description: The complete bounding box of this SDF.

name: union
description: Adds the given SDF to this one.

name: subtract
description: Subtracts the given SDF from this one.

name: intersect
description: Intersects the given SDF with this one.

return.description: A serialised description of this SDF.

name: toCSG
description: Translates this SDF into a CSG expression.

name: computeBoundingBox
description: Calculates the bounding box of this SDF.

throws.description: An error is thrown if the method is not overridden.

name: sample
description: Samples the volume's density at the given point in space.

return.description: The Euclidean distance to the surface.

throws.description: An error is thrown if the method is not overridden.

Sphere

name: computeBoundingBox
description: Calculates the bounding box of this density field.

name: sample

return.description: The euclidean distance to the surface.
A concise representation of this SDF.

A serialised description of this SDF.

name: src/volume/Voxel.js
Voxel
description: A cubic voxel that holds information about the surface of a volume.

name: materials
description:
Holds binary material information about all eight corners of this voxel.

A value of 0 means that this voxel is completely outside of the volume,
whereas a value of 255 means that it's fully inside of it. Any other
value indicates a material change which implies that the voxel contains
the surface.

name: edgeCount
description: The amount of edges that exhibit a material change in this voxel.

name: index
description:
A generated index for this voxel's vertex. Used during the construction
of the final polygons.

name: position
description: The vertex that lies inside this voxel.

name: normal
description: The normal of the vertex that lies inside this voxel.

name: qefData
description: A QEF data construct. Used to calculate the vertex position.

name: getWorker
description:
Polls an available worker and returns it. The worker will be excluded from
subsequent polls until it finishes its task and sends a message back.

return.description: A worker or null if all resources are currently exhausted.

name: clear
description: Resets this thread pool by closing all workers.

name: dispose
description: Removes all active workers and releases the worker program blob.
